Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Son-in-law \Son"-in-law`\, n.; pl. {Sons-in-law}. The husband of one's daughter; a man in his relationship to his wife's parents. [1913 Webster]
To take me as for thy son in lawe. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
son-in-law n : the husband of your daughter [also: {sons-in-law} (pl)]
